excerpt: Architecturally unique 19th-century building with archeological & historical artifacts, plus art.
detail_description: Napier Museum, located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a 19th-century architectural marvel housing archaeological artifacts, historical relics, and art pieces. The museum features royal seats with Chinese engravings, a musical bow in mahogany, colored windows, and intricately painted and carved rosewood ceilings. Situated near the museum is the Kanakakunnu Palace which was once used as a summer retreat by the Travancore royal family to entertain guests.
name: Napier Museum
address: LMS Vellayambalam Rd, near Museum Junction, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

excerpt: 1729 temple complex, known for its towering gateway and shrine to Padmanabha reclining on a serpent.
detail_description: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple is a prominent feature of Thiruvananthapuram, part of a temple complex with a towering gateway and shrine to Padmanabha reclining on a serpent. The city also boasts other attractions like the Keralan Museum, Napier Museum, Kerala Government Secretariat, and various palaces and historical sites.
name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple
address: West Nada, Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

excerpt: Short thoroughfare encircling the namesake colonial-era building situated on landscaped grounds.
detail_description: Kanakakunnu Palace Rd is a charming thoroughfare that encircles the historic Kanakakunnu Palace, set amidst beautifully landscaped grounds. The palace boasts ancient relics such as royal seats with Chinese engravings, a musical bow in mahogany, and intricately painted and carved rosewood ceilings. Constructed of wood from nearby forests, the palace is located at the foot of the Veli Hills near the river Valli.
name: Kanakakunnu Palace Rd
address: Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

excerpt: This colourful temple dedicated to a Hindu goddess is known for its female-focused annual festival.
detail_description: Attukal Bhagavathy Temple, located in Trivandrum, Kerala, is a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Devi. It is renowned for its annual festival, Attukal Pongala, which holds the Guinness World Record for the largest gathering of women in the world. This colorful temple is situated at the heart of Trivandrum and attracts around 1.5 million women during the festival.
name: Attukal Bhagavathy Temple
address: C Block, Attukal, Souparnika Nagar, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695009, India

detail_description: Kovalam Beach is home to the iconic Vizhinjam Lighthouse, a popular attraction that offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area. This 45-year-old lighthouse provides visitors with a breathtaking experience and is a must-visit when in the area. Additionally, Kovalam Beach's proximity to other attractions like Varkala Beach makes it an ideal destination for beach lovers looking to explore the beauty of Trivandrum.
name: Kovalam Beach
address: Kerala 695521, India

excerpt: Traditional & contemporary Indian works are shown at this gallery that was founded in 1935.
detail_description: Sri Chitra Art Gallery, established in 1935, is a renowned art gallery located near the Napier Museum in Trivandrum. It features a diverse collection of traditional and contemporary Indian artworks, including famous pieces by Raja Ravi Varma. The gallery also showcases paintings from various schools of art such as Mughal, Rajput, and Tanjore, along with an oriental collection from China, Japan, Tibet, and Bali.
name: Sri Chitra Art Gallery
address: GX64+94C, Museum Bains compound Rd, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

excerpt: Scenic lake with a beach, playground, floating cafe & sculptures, plus activities such as boating.
detail_description: Veli Lake Tourist Village is a picturesque destination in Thiruvananthapuram, offering a serene lake with a beach, playground, floating cafe, and sculptures. Visitors can enjoy various activities such as boating while taking in the natural beauty of the surroundings.
name: Veli Lake Tourist Village
address: GV6R+222, Veli - Perumathura Rd, Madhavapuram Colony, Veli, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695021, India

excerpt: Lively theme park devoted to the practice of magic, with street performances, aerialists & a museum.
detail_description: Magic Planet is a vibrant theme park dedicated to the world of magic, featuring street performances, aerialists, and a museum. Located in the Kinfra Film and Video Park, this innovative 75-acre complex offers an array of attractions such as an underground tunnel, mirror maze, shadow plays, virtual supermarket for mathematical skills development, children's park, food court, live performance theaters, and a research and development center.
name: Magic Planet
address: Kinfra Film and Video Park Kizhakkumbhagom, Kazhakkoottam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695585, India

detail_description: Thiruvananthapuram Zoo, established in 1857 as a supplement to the Napier Museum, has evolved from a recreational spot to a wildlife conservation center. Spanning 55 acres, it is Asia's oldest zoo and boasts over 80 animal species including white tigers, ostriches, pelicans, and vultures. The zoo also features botanical gardens with over 200 tree species and an impressive array of plants and orchids.
name: Thiruvananthapuram Zoo
address: GX63+6XP, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

excerpt: Busy temple known for its many Ganesha idols, including one seated with his right leg folded.
detail_description: Pazhavangadi Sree Maha Ganapathy Temple, situated in the bustling heart of Thiruvananthapuram, is a revered spiritual landmark dedicated to Lord Ganesha. The temple is famous for its many Ganesha idols, including one seated with his right leg folded in a unique posture known as Maha Ganapathi. Devotees often offer coconuts to Lord Ganesha as part of their ritual, breaking them in front of the temple.
name: Pazhavangaadi Sree Maha Ganapathy Temple
address: FWMW+RWP, Padmavilasam Rd, Pazhavangadi, Padma Nagar, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

excerpt: Picturesque freshwater lake offering abundant flora & fauna, boat rides & walking trails.
detail_description: Vellayani Lake, also known as Vellayani Kayal, is a stunning freshwater lake located in Thiruvananthapuram District, Kerala. Spanning about 50 hectares, it offers picturesque views and is home to abundant flora and fauna. Visitors can enjoy boat rides on the tranquil waters and explore the surrounding walking trails. The lake holds historical significance as it was once used as a summer retreat by the Travancore royal family for entertaining guests.
name: Vellayani Lake
address: Kerala

excerpt: Named for the 122 carved horses in its walls, this 1840s palace features a museum & guided tours.
detail_description: Kuthira Malika, also known as Puthen Malika Palace, is a 19th-century palace located next to the famous Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple in Trivandrum. Built by Maharaja Swathi Thirunal Balarama Varma, this palace is a fine example of traditional Travancore architecture, featuring exquisite wood carvings and unique designs.
name: Kuthira Malika
address: Bhajanapura Palace Rd, Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

excerpt: Palace museum with art & artifacts from the royal family, plus an annual courtyard music festival.
detail_description: Kuthira Maliga Palace Museum, located in Thiruvananthapuram District, Kerala, is a historical treasure trove showcasing art, artifacts, and royal collections. The palace's unique architectural design features 122 wooden horses on its exterior walls and horse face-shaped roof beams. It is part of a complex near the Padmanabhaswamy Temple and was built by Maharaja Swathi Balarama Varma.
name: Puthen Maliga Palace Museum
address: Near, Padmanabhaswamy Temple Road East Fort, Pazhavangadi Fort Palace Complex, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

detail_description: Located in Trivandrum, Priyadarshini Planetarium Rd is a must-visit for astronomy enthusiasts. As the first hybrid planetarium in India, it offers an immersive experience to learn about the universe and solar system. It's a great destination to expand your knowledge of cosmic mysteries.
name: Priyadarshini Planetarium Rd
address: PMG, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

detail_description: Located in Kovalam, the Rock Cut Cave Shiva Temple is a must-visit for history and spirituality enthusiasts. Dating back to the 8th century, this temple is carved from rock and showcases intricately crafted sculptures and ancient architectural marvels. The serene ambiance and beautiful surroundings make it an ideal spot for a romantic stroll. The temple features a large natural well and a shrine that appears to be suspended in the sky due to its unexcavated nature.
name: Rock-Cut Cave Shiva Temple, Vizhinjam
address: Police Station, Vizhinjam, Kovalam, Kerala 695521, India

excerpt: Scenic lake with a beach, playground, floating cafe & sculptures, plus activities such as boating.
detail_description: Veli Lake Tourist Village is a nature retreat located near Trivandrum, where the River Veli meets the Arabian Sea. The village offers a serene lake with activities such as boating and pedal boating amidst lush greenery and migratory bird sightings. Visitors can explore walking trails, floating bridges, a children's park, and an open-air theater for performances. Additionally, the village features a floating cafe and opportunities for rock climbing.
name: Veli Lake Tourist Village
address: GV6R+222, Veli - Perumathura Rd, Madhavapuram Colony, Veli, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695021, India

excerpt: This sandy stretch of coastline for recreation hosts a ceremonial procession honoring Hindu deities.
detail_description: Shangumugham Beach, located near the city airport, is a stunning destination with clear waters and pristine white sand. It is celebrated for its unspoiled beauty and cleanliness, making it one of the most picturesque spots in the area. This popular beach attracts both locals and tourists who come to relax and admire the serene atmosphere along the Arabian Sea. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking sunsets, indulge in beach activities like kite flying, and savor local street food from nearby stalls.
name: Shangumugham Beach
address: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India

excerpt: Educational exhibits & activities illustrating scientific principles, plus a planetarium & 3D films.
detail_description: In Thiruvananthapuram, the KSST Museum & Priyadarsini Planetarium offers educational exhibits and activities showcasing scientific principles, along with a planetarium and 3D films. The museum is dedicated to science communication and nurturing scientific curiosity, especially among young people. It features over 300 exhibits covering various fields such as electrical, electronics, and power. Additionally, it hosts science and technology awareness classes for students and the general public.
name: KSST Museum & Priyadarsini Planetarium
address: Priyadarshini Planetarium Road, Junction, Near, PMG, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

detail_description: Aruvikkara Dam, situated on the outskirts of Thiruvananthapuram City, is a major tourist attraction responsible for supplying water to the area. The serene Karamana River flows through this picturesque location, making it an ideal spot for a weekend getaway from the State capital. Visitors can enjoy a fun-filled jaunt and take in the natural beauty of Aruvikkara Dam while exploring its surroundings.
name: Aruvikkara Dam
address: Aruvikkara, Kerala 695541

excerpt: Kovalam is a small coastal town in the southern Indian state of Kerala, south of Thiruvananthapuram. At the southern end of Lighthouse Beach is a striped lighthouse with a viewing platform. Palm-backed beaches also include Hawa Beach and Samudra Beach. Heading south, Vizhinjam Juma Masjid mosque overlooks the busy fishing harbor. Inland, Sagarika Marine Research Aquarium displays technology used in pearl production.
detail_description: Kovalam, a charming coastal town in Kerala, India, is known for its picturesque beaches and vibrant atmosphere. Lighthouse Beach, with its iconic striped lighthouse and panoramic views, is a popular spot for tourists. The town also boasts other beautiful beaches like Hawa Beach and Samudra Beach. Away from the shore, visitors can explore the Vizhinjam Juma Masjid mosque and the bustling fishing harbor.
name: Kovalam
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Lakeside recreation spot featuring kids' playgrounds, a swimming pool & water activities.
detail_description: Akkulam Tourist Village is a serene and picturesque destination located near Trivandrum, Kerala. Situated along the banks of Akkulam Lake, it offers a range of activities for leisure seekers and nature lovers. Visitors can enjoy boating, fishing, and relaxing walks amidst lush greenery and beautiful landscapes. The village features kids' playgrounds, a swimming pool, water activities, beautifully landscaped gardens, and a children's park.
name: Akkulam Tourist Village
address: Ulloor - Akkulam Rd, Aakkulam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695011, India

excerpt: Hindu temple featuring a bright tower, elaborate carvings & a pond, devoted to the goddess Chamundi.
detail_description: Karikkakom Sri Chamundi Temple is a 600-year-old Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Chamundi. It features a bright tower, intricate carvings, and a serene pond. The temple is set in lush green surroundings and is revered by worshippers of Goddess Kali. It holds historical significance as it was once the site for delivering justice during the monarchy era.
name: Karikkakom Sree Chamundi Temple
address: Karikkakom, Karikkakam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695007, India

detail_description: CSI Christ Church, located in the vibrant town of Palayam in Trivandrum, is a stunning gothic church that has contributed to the historical and architectural splendor of the area for over 19 decades. As the oldest church in the city, it was consecrated in 1859 and boasts a simple yet elegant Gothic style with beautiful stained glass windows depicting The Good Shepherd.
name: CSI Christ Church
address: Mahatma Gandhi Rd, opp. Legisalative Assembly, University of Kerala Senate House Campus, Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

detail_description: The Natural History Museum in Thiruvananthapuram is a treasure trove of historical artifacts and exhibits. The museum showcases a diverse collection of animal skeletons, dioramas, and stuffed birds. One of the highlights is a detailed model of a traditional nalakettu home on the second floor, providing insight into the lifestyle of the Nairs, an ancient warrior clan.
name: Natural History Museum
address: GX64+3J4, Maruthankuzhy-PTP Rd, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695038, India

detail_description: Connemara Market, also known as Palayam Market, is a historic shopping hub in Thiruvananthapuram. Established in 1857, it was originally built to supply daily goods to the army. The market offers a variety of products including fresh spices, vegetables, fruits, clothes, fish and goat meat at affordable prices. It's a vibrant marketplace where you can experience local life and find locally produced items such as handicrafts, textiles, spices and souvenirs.
name: Connemara Market, Palayam
address: GX32+5CF, University of Kerala Senate House Campus, Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695034, India

excerpt: Traditional 2-story Kerala palace, built in 1677, with folklore & numismatics museums & tours.
detail_description: Koyikkal Palace, a traditional 2-story Kerala palace dating back to 1677, is home to folklore and numismatics museums. The Keralam Museum has implemented modern techniques in refurbishing archaeological museums at various locations and played a pivotal role in establishing district heritage museums across the region. This historical site is one of the major tourist attractions in Thiruvananthapuram, offering visitors a glimpse into Kerala's rich cultural heritage.
name: Koyikkal Palace
address: Sathram Junction, Pazhavadi, Nedumangad, Kerala 695541, India

excerpt: 1729 temple complex, known for its towering gateway and shrine to Padmanabha reclining on a serpent.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram, the Padmanabhaswamy Temple is a stunning example of Dravidian architecture and spiritual grandeur. This ancient temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, boasts intricate carvings and majestic gopurams that transport visitors back in time. The main deity is depicted reclining on Ananta, the serpent god, which adds to its allure. Pilgrims and tourists alike are drawn to its serene atmosphere and rich history.
name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple
address: West Nada, Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

excerpt: Traditional red-&-white striped lighthouse, constructed in 1972, with an interior spiral staircase.
detail_description: Nestled near the picturesque Kovalam beach in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, the Vizhinjam Lighthouse is a striking red-and-white striped beacon that has been guiding sailors since its completion in 1972. Standing tall at 36 meters on Kurumkal Hill, this lighthouse not only serves as a vital navigational aid but also offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and the surrounding lush landscapes.
name: Vizhinjam Light House
address: 9XMH+5V4, Light house Junction, Vizhinjam, near Kovalam, Kovalam, Kerala 695521, India

excerpt: Green mall with international brands, kids' play areas, a multiplex, food court & vertical garden.
detail_description: The Mall of Travancore is a modern shopping destination in Trivandrum, offering a wide range of experiences for visitors. As the first-ever mall in the city, it boasts over 300 national and international brands, making it a paradise for shoppers. The mall features 150 stores, including renowned names like Jockey Exclusive and Trends. In addition to shopping, visitors can enjoy entertainment at the multiplex theater or indulge in delicious cuisine at the food court.
name: Mall of Travancore
address: Int'l Airport Rd, near Ananthapuri Hospital, Eanchakkal, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695024, India

excerpt: This simple, compact aquarium features tanks displaying a unique collection marine life.
detail_description: Sagarika Marine Research Aquarium, also known as Vizhinjam Marine Aquarium, is a compact yet fascinating destination showcasing a diverse collection of marine life. Situated on an 8-acre plot, this aquarium boasts over 100 species of tropical fish, including groupers, catfish, sharks, and stingrays. Visitors can witness captivating moon jellyfish and sea nettles in the jellyfish tank during feeding time.
name: Sagarika Marine Research Aquarium
address: Near Light House Road, Vizhinjam Harbour Road, Kovalam, Kerala 695521, India

excerpt: Vizhinjam is an area located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of the state of Kerala in India. which belongs to Thiruvananthapuram Corporation. It is located 16 km south west from the city centre and 17 km south of Trivandrum International Airport along NH66. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Vizhinjam, situated in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a unique village within the Neyyattinkara Taluk under the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation. The area is home to the ancient Vizhinjam temple, a Hindu religious site dating back to the 8th century and located approximately 20 km from Trivandrum's city center.
name: Vizhinjam
address: Kovalam, Kerala, India

detail_description: Puthen Malika Palace Museum, located in Thiruvananthapuram, is a must-visit destination for history and art enthusiasts. The museum houses an impressive collection of wooden art and valuable artifacts, making it one of India's most valuable museums. Visitors can explore the beautiful architecture and immerse themselves in the rich cultural heritage on display.
name: Puthen Malika Palace Museum
address: Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

detail_description: Sunil's Wax Museum in Trivandrum is a top-rated attraction that showcases an impressive collection of meticulously crafted wax statues. Founded by renowned artist and sculptor Sunil Kandalloor, the museum features lifelike figures of celebrities, historical icons, political leaders, and cultural personalities. Visitors can marvel at the attention to detail in each statue, capturing the likeness and personality of the subjects. The museum also boasts wax sculptures of famous sport stars and significant historical figures.
name: Sunil's Wax Museum Trivandrum
address: South Street of Padmanabha Swamy Temple, opposite Priyadarshini Hall, Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

detail_description: Puthenthope Beach, nestled in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a hidden treasure offering a peaceful retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. The beach boasts a serene atmosphere with swaying palm trees and golden sands, providing an ideal setting for relaxation. Unlike more commercialized beaches, Puthenthope maintains its natural allure and is frequented by local fishermen, adding to its authentic coastal charm.
name: Puthenthope Beach
address: Bus Stop, Veli - Perumathura Rd, Puthenthope, Kerala 695586, India

detail_description: Kowdiar Palace, situated approximately 4 km from Trivandrum, serves as the official residence of the current Maharajah of Travancore. Constructed by Maharaja Moolam Thirunal in the 20th century, this architectural gem showcases a splendid fusion of Travancore-style design and architecture. The palace is steeped in history and is surrounded by well-maintained grounds, making it a must-visit destination in Kerala.
name: Kowdiar Palace
address: GXF7+H8C, Kowdiar Gardens, Kowdiar, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695003, India

detail_description: Chalai Bazaar is a must-visit when exploring Trivandrum, India. As the busiest street market in Kerala, it offers an authentic glimpse into local life. Here, visitors can immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere and explore a wide array of goods, from fresh produce and spices to clothing and household items. It's a bustling hub where one can experience the hustle and bustle of everyday life while discovering unique treasures and enjoying local flavors.
name: Chalai Bazaar
address: Chalai, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India

excerpt: Coastal Catholic church & religious site known for annual feast that draws thousands of worshippers.
detail_description: Madre De Deus Church, also known as Vettucaud Church, is a renowned coastal Catholic church and religious site famous for its annual feast that attracts thousands of worshippers.
name: Madre De Deus Church (Vettucaud Church)
address: Veli Sanghumugham Rd, Balanagar, Vettukadu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695021, India

excerpt: This sandy beach features unusual rock formations at its edge & large waves suitable for surfing.
detail_description: Samudra Beach is a stunning shoreline located in the southern part of Kerala. It is known for its unusual rock formations and large waves that make it perfect for surfing enthusiasts. This beach is often overshadowed by popular tourist spots, but those who appreciate serene and secluded places will love Samudra Beach. Visitors can enjoy impressive scenic views and have an afternoon picnic on this well-maintained coast.
name: Samudra Beach Park
address: Kovalam, Kerala 695527, India

excerpt: Old royal palace offering a lavish interior, lush grounds & cultural events, including dance shows.
detail_description: Kanakakkunnu Palace, situated in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a splendid old royal palace that boasts a luxurious interior and lush grounds. It was once a prominent hub of the ancient Travancore kingdom and served as an entertaining ground for royal guests. Built in the 19th century by Sree Moolam Thirunal, it features Colonial architecture with typical Kerala style facade.
name: Kanakakkunnu Palace
address: Sooryakanthi Rd, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

excerpt: Upscale global cuisine presented in an elegant, restored 18th-century home with a garden patio.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Trivandrum, Villa Maya is situated within a beautifully restored 18th-century Dutch manor. This upscale restaurant offers a glimpse into the city's colonial past while serving exquisite Karavali and seafood cuisine. The elegant interiors, adorned with antique furnishings and verdant foliage, create a sophisticated atmosphere ideal for a distinctive dining experience. Signature dishes such as Malabar Parotta with kadala curry and Kerala-style chicken curry showcase the region's rich culinary heritage.
name: Villa Maya
address: MUTHOOT SKY CHEF, No-120 Palayam Airport Road Near, Vallakkadavu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695008, India

excerpt: Picturesque beach providing canal views, sculptures, boat rides, a charming church & garden area.
detail_description: Veli Beach, located approximately 10 kilometers from Thiruvananthapuram city center, offers a serene coastal experience with its calm backwaters and floating bridge. The adjacent Veli Tourist Village provides opportunities for pedal boating, kayaking, and other water sports. Visitors can stroll across the suspended bridge, explore parks and gardens, or enjoy a picnic in the beautiful surroundings. This picturesque destination is known for its crystal-clear waters, golden sands, and tranquil Veli Lagoon.
name: Veli Beach
address: Madhavapuram Road, Veli, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695021, India

detail_description: LuLu Mall Thiruvananthapuram is a must-visit for an unparalleled international shopping experience. As India's largest mall, it spans an impressive 2,000,000 square feet and houses exclusive global brands, top-notch entertainment options, and diverse dining experiences. From traditional Kerala cuisine to international flavors like Arabic and Italian, the food courts and multi-cuisine restaurants offer a wide array of choices.
name: LuLu Mall Thiruvananthapuram
address: Lulu International Shopping Mall Pvt. Ltd TC 91/270, Akkulam Bridge, Anayara Post, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695029, India

detail_description: The Palace Turfs @ Kowdiar is a historical gem in Trivandrum, Kerala, India. Built by Maharajah Sree Chithira Thirunal for his sister's wedding in 1934, this palace is now owned by the heirs of Sethu Parvathi Bayi. Set on a small hilltop spanning 100 acres and over 300 meters above sea level, it boasts stunning Kerala architectural design and enjoys refreshing winds from the nearby Arabian Sea.
name: The Palace Turfs @ Kowdiar
address: The Palace, Turfs Rd, Kowdiar Gardens, Kowdiar, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695003, India

detail_description: Chalai Market Road in Trivandrum is a lively shopping destination where you can experience the vibrant local culture. The bustling market offers a wide array of goods including spices, textiles, handicrafts, and fresh produce. It's a great place to immerse yourself in the local atmosphere and explore the diverse offerings of this bustling marketplace.
name: Chalai Market Road
address: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695036, India

excerpt: Thiruvananthapuram (or Trivandrum) is the capital of the southern Indian state of Kerala. It's distinguished by its British colonial architecture and many art galleries. Its also home to Kuthira Malika (or Puthen Malika) Palace, adorned with carved horses and displaying collections related to the Travancore royal family, whose regional capital was here from the 18th20th centuries.
detail_description: Thiruvananthapuram, also known as Trivandrum, is the capital of Kerala in southern India. The city boasts British colonial architecture and numerous art galleries. Visitors can explore the Kuthira Malika Palace, adorned with intricately carved horses and showcasing collections related to the Travancore royal family.
name: Thiruvananthapuram
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Interactive museum tracing Kerala history & culture, from the Neolithic age to the present day.
detail_description: Keralam - Museum of History and Heritage is an interactive museum located in Trivandrum, Kerala. Housed in a 120-year-old heritage building within the Kerala Tourism complex, it offers a comprehensive journey through Kerala's history and culture from the Neolithic age to the present day.
name: Keralam - Museum of History and Heritage
address: Corporation Office Tourism Directorate Compound, LMS Vellayambalam Rd, near Thiruvananthapuram, University of Kerala Senate House Campus, Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

excerpt: Outlet for Middle Eastern restaurant chain masterminded in 1979 and known for its ice creams.
detail_description: Zam Zam Restaurant is a well-established Middle Eastern dining spot that first opened its doors in 1979. Located near the University of Kerala, this restaurant offers a unique 'Make your own meal' concept, allowing diners to customize their dining experience by choosing from a variety of starters, mains, and sides.
name: Zam Zam Restaurant
address: opp. MLA Hostel, University of Kerala Senate House Campus, Palayam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695034, India

name: Elephant Rehabilitation Centre
address: H544+M74, Neyyar Dam Road, Kappukadu, Kerala 695572, India

excerpt: Nature attraction featuring deer viewing, a crocodile park & boat rides past Neyyar Dam.
detail_description: Neyyar Wildlife Sanctuary, situated in Trivandrum, Kerala, is a nature lover's paradise. It offers deer viewing, a crocodile park, and boat rides on the picturesque Neyyar Dam. The sanctuary features attractions like the Bus Safari, Elephant Rehabilitation Center, Lion Park, and Crocodile Farm. Visitors can also enjoy guided trekking and overnight camping amidst lush greenery. The serene atmosphere makes it an ideal getaway for hiking or bird-watching enthusiasts.
name: Neyyar Wildlife Sanctuary
address: G5M2+J4C, Kallikkad, Kerala 695572, India

excerpt: Vibrant Hindu temple with ornate architectural details offering yearly festivals & seaside views.
detail_description: Aazhimala Shiva Temple, located near the coast in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple offers ornate architectural details and hosts yearly festivals. One of its main attractions is the towering 58-feet tall statue of Lord Shiva in a meditative pose, set against the backdrop of the Arabian Sea. Visitors can enjoy picturesque views of the sea from the temple and capture mesmerizing photographs.
name: Aazhimala Shiva Temple
address: Pulinkudi, Adimalathura, PO, Mulloor, Thiruvananthapuram, Kazhivoor, Kerala 695501, India
